attributes.action: Allow the electorate to hold ALL elected officials to account by allowing them to 'recall' their elected official.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
In America, the electorate have the right to petition an elected official out of office before his/her tenure is up. Elected Officials in the UK do not and therefore can remain in office. 

Therefore, MPs who recently disgraced themselves in the expenses scandal will not step down until the next General Election. 

By giving the people the chance to petition a 'no confidence' motion in their MP, (with a certain number of signatures required - so this doesn't happen every day), the MP would be forced to resign.

This would be applied across all levels of Government and therefore to all elected officials.
